exclusion:
1. Bring your Titan Valve Actuator close to the Z-Wave gateway (hub), if possible.
  2. Put the Z-Wave hub into exclusion mode.
  3. Tap the Z-Wave button 3 times quickly (it will flash and beep once each time you tap to confirm communication).
  4. Your hub will confirm exclusion, the LED indicator on the actuator will turn green for 3 seconds, and the device will sound 2 short beeps for a successful exclusion. The actuator will disappear from your controller’s device list. The LED indicator on the Titan will go back to the yellow blinking mode.
inclusion:
1. ADD DEVICE to your hub.
  • Initiate inclusion (pairing) in the app (or web interface).


2. Finalize inclusion at the actuator.

  • Tap THE Z-WAVE BUTTON 3 TIMES if using traditional Z-Wave inclusion.
label: ZAC36
overview:
Features

  • Automatic shut-off actuator for your main water valve.
  • Connect it to your Z-Wave hub for full smart home control.
  • Use it offline with the included leak sensor probe.
  • Built-in temperature detection for instant freeze detection.
  • Retrofit installation with no tools required.
  • Use with ½” – 1 ¼” ball valves only (close prior to installation).
  • Indoor & outdoor installation with IP66 rating (avoid direct sunlight).
  • NEW 700 series Z-Wave chip for better range and faster control.
  • S2 Security and SmartStart for easier inclusion.

Specifications

  • Model Number: ZAC36
  • Z-Wave Signal Frequency: 908.42 MHz.
  • Power: 12 V DC (1 A) power supply (included).
  • Temperature Sensor Range: -40° to 257° F.
  •  Sound Indicator: up to 85 dB
  • Z-Wave Range: Up to 400 feet line of sight (up to 130 feet indoors).
  • Operating Temperature: 14-122° F (-10-50° C).
  • Installation and Use: Indoor & outdoor (IP66)
  • Standby Power Consumption: 0.12 W
  •  Full Operation Power Consumption: 8.4 W

category.label: Valve
category.description: Valves used to control water or gas. e.g. a flow stop valve.

parameters.label: Water Valve Command and Reporting Behavior
parameters.description: Decide which Z-Wave commands and reports you'd like to use to display when the device is open or closed (or to open / close the device).

options.label: reports on when the valve is open (opens the valve when an "on" report
reports off when the valve is open (opens the valve when an "off" repo

parameters.label: Association Group 2 Report (Closing)
parameters.description: Decide which report is sent to Group 2 when parameter 17 is set to value 1 and the valve is closing.

parameters.label: Association Group 2 Report (Opening)
parameters.description: Decide which report is sent to Group 2 when parameter 17 is set to value 1 and the valve is opening.

parameters.label: Temperature Reporting Scale
parameters.description: Choose which scale you'd like the device to report temperature in.

parameters.label: Temperature Reporting Threshold
parameters.description: Set the temperature reporting threshold.

parameters.label: Temperature Reporting Offset
parameters.description: Set the temperature reporting offset.

parameters.label: Temperature Reporting Overheat Alarm
parameters.description: Set the overheat alarm trigger value.

parameters.label: Temperature Reporting Overheat Alarm Cancellation
parameters.description: Set the overheat alarm cancellation trigger value.

parameters.label: Association Group 4 Reports Overheat Alarm
parameters.description: Decide which report is sent to Group 4 when the overheat alarm (set in parameter 36) is triggered.

parameters.label: Association Group 4 Reports Overheat Alarm Cancelled
parameters.description: Decide which report is sent to Group 4 when the overheat alarm is cancelled.

parameters.label: Temperature Reporting Freeze Alarm
parameters.description: Set the freeze alarm trigger value.

parameters.label: Temperature Reporting Freeze Alarm Cancellation
parameters.description: Set the freeze alarm cancellation trigger value.

parameters.label: Freeze Alarm Operation Mode
parameters.description: Decide if you want to allow the valve actuator to open and close during freeze alarm mode.
parameters.overview: If the actuator is disabled, it won't react to Z-Wave or manual triggers to open or close until the freeze alarm is cleared.

parameters.label: Association Group 5 Reports Freeze Alarm
parameters.description: Decide which report is sent to Group 5 when the freeze alarm (set in parameter 40) is triggered.

parameters.label: Association Group 5 Reports Freeze Alarm Cancelled
parameters.description: Decide which report is sent to Group 5 when the freeze alarm is cancelled.  Values:

parameters.label: Association Group 3 Reports Leak Alarm
parameters.description: Decide which report is sent to Group 3 when a leak alarm is triggered (from the connected leak detection probe).

parameters.label: Association Group 3 Reports Leak Alarm Cleared
parameters.description: Decide which report is sent to Group 3 when the leak alarm is cleared (water is no longer detected by the connected probe).

parameters.label: Leak Alarm Operation Mode
parameters.description: Decide if you want to allow the valve actuator to open and close during a leak alarm event.
parameters.overview: If the actuator is disabled, it won't react to Z-Wave or manual triggers to open or close until the leak alarm is cleared.

parameters.label: Auto Test Mode
parameters.description: Decide when you'd like the actuator to perform an auto test mode once it's installed.
parameters.overview: The actuator will periodically make a 1/8 turn to ensure it is operational to self test.

options.label: enabled only when excluded from the Z-Wave hub
enabled only when included to the Z-Wave hub
enabled both when included or excluded (default)

parameters.label: Auto Test Mode Frequency
parameters.description: Decide how often you'd like the actuator to perform the auto test described in parameter 61.

parameters.label: Sound Alarms and Notifications
parameters.description: Decide if you'd like to receive sound (beep) feedback when operating the actuator as well as sound alarms for different modes and alarms the actuator goes into when installed.

parameters.label: LED Indicator Brightness Level
parameters.description: Decide how bright you'd like the LED indicator to be on your actuator. If you set it to value 0, the LED indicator will be disabled.

parameters.label: Z-Wave Button Lock Protection
parameters.description: Enable Z-Wave button lock protection if you'd like to prevent the Z-Wave button from being locked accidentally.
